SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
SALESFORCE SCHEDULER
Create Work Types in Salesforce Scheduler

Work types are templates that are included in a work type group —appointment topic— and service territory —branch location, saving you time and making standardizing your appointment scheduling easier. You can set parameters such as the default appointment duration, buffers before and after your appointment, and the appointment availability horizon.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS
Available in: Lightning Experience.
Available in: Enterprise and Unlimited Editions


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To view the Work Types tab and work types:	Read on work types
To create work types:	Create on work types
To edit work types:	Edit on work types
To delete work types:	Delete on work types
To view service territory work types:	Read on service territories AND Read on work types
On the Work Types tab, click New.
Enter a name and description.
Use a name that indicates the kind of records that can be created from the work type. For example, Mortgage or Account Opening.
If necessary, select operating hours for the work type.
If you don't select operating hours for a work type, the work type is considered to be always available.
NOTE Select operating hours without concurrent time slots. Only the concurrent time slots in the service territory member’s operating hours are available for selection during appointment scheduling.
Enter an estimated duration for the appointment, and a duration type in minutes or hours.
WARNING Don’t specify more than 24 hours as the estimated duration.
If necessary, specify the time interval between appointment start times.
For example, if you set the interval as 15 minutes, then appointments can be conducted every 15 minutes, such as 10:00 AM, 10:15 AM, and 10:30 AM, from the start of your work day. You can set a time interval from 5 through 720 minutes.
NOTE If you don’t specify a value for this field, Salesforce Scheduler considers the value specified for the Appointment Start Time Interval field in the default scheduling policy.
If necessary, select an appointment category.
If you want the work type to be available for both drop-in and scheduled appointments, select an appointment category with both options selected.
If no appointment categories are available, then create an appointment category.
Select + New Appointment Category.
Enter a name.
Enter a name that indicates the type of category. For example, Drop In or Scheduled.
Select one or more category types, and then save your changes.
Drop In	For customers who visit the branch without a prior appointment.
Regular	For customers who schedule an appointment before visiting the branch.
Group	For creating a multiple-attendee service appointment.
The appointment category is also related to the service appointment record. If you don’t create a category that supports only the drop-in appointments, Salesforce Scheduler automatically creates the drop-in category when a participant is added to an active waitlist. The Appointment Category field of the service appointment record is also updated to reflect the drop-in category.

For scheduled appointments, the Appointment Category field of the service appointment record remains empty even if you created a category to support only the scheduled appointments.

NOTE Starting with Summer ‘24, the Group category type appears in the appointment category layout by default. For existing instances, add the Group field in the appointment category layout under the Appointment Category section. For more information, see Customize Page Layouts with the Enhanced Page Layout Editor.
If necessary, specify meeting preparation and wrap-up time by specifying Block Time Before Appointment and Block Time After Appointment in minutes or hours.
During appointment scheduling, the number of available time slots is adjusted to accommodate the before and after buffer times.
WARNING Don’t specify more than 24 hours as buffer time.
NOTE Enable the Block Resource Availability setting to reflect the before and after appointment buffers on the Salesforce calendar.
If necessary, enter Timeframe Start, Timeframe Start Unit, Timeframe End, and Timeframe End Unit.
NOTE Timeframe Start and Timeframe End show time slots in a dynamic time frame based on when a user books an appointment. Salesforce Scheduler shows only time slots that start after the duration that’s set in Timeframe Start and end before the duration that’s set in Timeframe End. For example, you’ve set Timeframe Start to 2 days and Timeframe End to 5 days and a user schedules an appointment on Sep 13, 10:00 AM. Then, only time slots that start on or after Sep 15, 10:00 AM and end on or before Sep 18, 10:00 AM are shown.
If you want to use the work type for appointments with group appointment mode, enter the maximum number of attendees that can attend a group service appointment.
NOTE Starting with Summer ‘24, the Attendee Limit field appears in the work type layout by default. For existing instances, add the Attendee Limit field in the work type layout under the Description section. For more information, see Customize Page Layouts with the Enhanced Page Layout Editor.
Save your changes.

After a work type is created, add skills requirements for the work type on the Skill Requirements related list. Associate the work type with a service territory on the Service Territory Work Types related list and an appointment topic on the Work Type Group Members related list.

SEE ALSO
